p: TEM is a powerful imaging technique used to estimate the morphological properties and size of NPs [ 103, 170, 172, 173]. TEM interacts with the specimen via a beam of electrons to pattern the image on the photographic plane [ 174]. The remarkable use of TEM is to form a high-resolution image of the NPsâ€™ atomic space [ 175]. In contrast with SEM, TEM provides higher image accuracy and extra analytical measurements [ 176]. An image of the cross-sectional area for synthesized AgNPs from Eucalyptus leaf extract has been obtained utilizing TEM [ 87]. TEM has been adopted to show the morphological structure of AgNPs [ 93] and FeNPs [ 95, 107] mediated by Eucalyptus.
